company_name: Bank of New York Mellon Corp
item1_summary:
The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation, a Delaware corporation (NYSE symbol: BK), is a global company headquartered in New York, New York . With its subsidiaries, BNY has been in business since 1784 . We divide our businesses into three principal business segments: Securities Services, Market and Wealth Services and Investment and Wealth Management . We also have an Other segment, which includes the leasing portfolio, corporate treasury activities .
 BNY Mellon has four other U.S. bank and/or trust company subsidiaries . Most of our Investment Management business and Pershing businesses are direct or indirect non-bank subsidiaries of BNY . BNY’s banking subsidiaries outside the United States are subject to regulation by non-U.S.-regulatory authorities in addition to the Board of Governors .
 BNY SA/NV’s activities are in the Securities Services and Market and Wealth Services segments of BNY with a focus on global custody, asset servicing and collateral management . The firm has branches in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, Copenhagen, Denmark, Dublin, Ireland; Frankfurt, Germany; Madrid, Spain; Milan, Italy; Paris, France; and Wroclaw, Poland .
 At Dec. 31, 2024, we had approximately 41,500 participants in our 401(k) plan, including former employees . The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation again provided eligible employees an award of 10 restricted stock units (“RSUs”) or “BK Shares” BK Shares is an equity grant that allows for eligible employees to become equity owners .
 At Dec. 31, 2024, BNY and its subsidiaries had approximately 51,800 full-time employees . Approximately 60% of our total employees were based outside the U.S., with approximately 10,900 employees in Europe, the Middle East and Africa (“EMEA”) and approximately 18,900 in the Asia-Pacific region (‘APAC’)
 Our Securities Services and Market and Wealth Services businesses compete with domestic and international financial services firms that offer custody services, corporate trust services, clearing services, collateral management services, credit services and credit services . Our ability to continue to compete effectively depends in large part on our ability to attract new employees, retain, develop and motivate existing employees, amid heightened regulatory restrictions .
